greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Total number of vertices in graph formed by the straight line segments connecting the edges of an equilateral triangle with the n-1 points resulting from a subdivision of the sides into n equal pieces, counting coinciding intersection points only once.
comment: a(n) <= 3*(n^2-n+1), with equality iff n is odd and not a member of A332378. A331423 gives the difference between a(n) and the upper bound.
link: N. J. A. Sloane, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
xref: Cf. A091908, A092098 (number of cells), A332376 (number of edges), A332378, A331423.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Feb 13 2020
